critique: This document pertains to the employment of individuals on merchant vessels of the United States and their potential impact on national security. It grants the Commandant authority to ensure that individuals employed on these vessels do not pose a threat to national security. The document reflects a focus on national security concerns during its time. It does not directly address immigration, economic regulation, or social inclusion. It could be seen as expanding executive power, but only in the context of national security. It does not obviously favor either state or federal primacy.
